result.execSummary:
All charges against Sue NMI Xiong in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sue NMI Xiong is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sue NMI Xiong

records.addlTxt: Court calls 22CF12 & 22CF43  @ 09:03 AM Attorney John P Runde in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Both case set for Preliminary Hearing. State gives history of case, & explains reason why defendant is not in court. State request good cause to extend time limits or amend bond to $500 cash bond.  Atty Runde would like statute RE amendment of bond to get extra 10 days.  Court explains.  Atty Runde would like statute.  Atty Runde heard on defendant appearance and not being heard on bond modification.  State applied to victim rights. Atty Runde first issue is bond issue and gives argument. Atty Runde request signature bond. Court question Atty Runde.  Atty Runde can't speak with client.  State objects to signature bond and request good cause and feels bond modification is mute.  State quotes statute regarding time limits for p.h. Atty Runde replies. Respond by State. Court gives ruling and finds no bad faith by State, and gives State two proposal by Atty Runde which would State like to accept, 22CF12 already on signature bond per State.  Recess @ 9:20. Reconvene @ 9:28. All parties present in courtroom. Victim now appears. State moves to dismiss without prejudice 22CF43 and 22Cf12 see has time to set p.h. State can request adjournment on 22CF12.  Atty Runde objects to adjournment.  State heard on appearance not required for defendant. Court finds if def was satified that defendant appearance not required but not fair to defendant.  Court dismiss both case without prejudice. State will file new complaint today.  Atty Runde gives statement.  Court rules both cases dismissed without prejudice and State may refile. State has nothing.  Atty Runde heard on bond modification regarding victim wishes regarding conditions. Court will not make State be heard on Atty Runde request.

Court calls 22CF43 & 22CF12  @ 02:50 PM Defendant Sue NMI Xiong in court, via zoom with attorney John Runde  Defendant Sue NMI Xiong in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sue NMI Xiong appeared by video means with Attorney.  Atty Runde has copy of complaint in 22CF43 & 22CF12 and waives reading and heard on bail/bond and request signature.  Atty Runde doesn't waive right to p.h. State heard on bond in 22CF43 and gives recommendation and request no contact with victim or under statute 940.47. Court reviews cases. Atty Runde makes argument on allegations.  Court reviews orders $800.00 cash bond with conditions. Atty Runde heard on victim contact with def.  Court finds risk with alleged victm and gives facts. State would like to be set for bail/bond modification also on the 7th. Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Sue NMI Xiong
Current: 740 Jackson, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 02-11-2022)
Prior: 720 Jackson Street, Wausau, WI 54403

10:14 AM Defendant Sue NMI Xiong in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sue NMI Xiong appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.    Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.  State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Def. is on a probation hold. Court orders $2,000 Signature bond with no contact with alleged victim. Court adjouns @ 10:18 am.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
